description:
Two for Two.

If you like Mexican food this stop won't disappoint!

Had the Al Pastor super burrito and their salsa bar.

Small place qualifies as a top ten hole in the wall.

Highly reccomend!
author: Michael M.

description:
Good Mexican restaurant in the mission. 
Quesadilla suiza - 5/5
Carne asada tack -3.5/5
Pozole rojo - 3/5
author: Antonella H.

description:
This place is unbelievable!  Form the super burrito to the fish tacos and the steak quesadillas!   I was pretty much blacked out and I could still remember the freshness and flavors of this food.  The best mex food I've had in Sf hands down!  I might try it before the night starts next time!  The place is clean as well which is difficult to find in the city these days.

Food 5
Service 4.5
Overall 5
author: Patrick C.

description: This place was really good and had all the things that remind me of home. Chilaquiles were good and by the looks of everyone else's order around me, everything else on the menu is at worst good.
author: Ricardo C.

description: One of the best places for Mexican food in the city. Their weekend specials of Birria, and Menudo are the best I've had since leaving home. I have yet to be disappointed with any selection on their menu. They also have really good aguas fresca. My favorite, the Horchata, is also the best I've had in the city. Top it off with good smiling service every visit and this place is a win.
author: The Walking Y.

description: Being from LA, it's been tough finding quality Mexican food in my new neighborhood despite the dozens of taquerias flooding the nearby blocks. This is actually the first one I've liked and so far I've tried the steak quesadilla and steak nachos. The food here is absolutely delicious and I won't go anywhere else for Mexican food in my neighborhood, especially when I want to show visitors or friends a good time.
author: Usman P.

description:
My new favorite spot to satisfy my Mexican food cravings! The al pastor (marinated pork) is super flavorful and juicy. 

Love the unlimited self serve salsa station. 

The workers here are super friendly, and they bring your order to where you're seated.
author: Bonnie T.

description: Fantastic shrimp ceviche! Salsa bar two thumbs up. I had a couple of bites of my husbands carnitas burrito and that was also a major taste bud delight. I watched with envy as others received their pozole. Guess what I'm having on my next visit?
author: Cindy J.

description:
The only amazing mexican food in San Francisco. Do yourself a favor and go here.

I got a carne asada super burrito and it was nearly perfect. The horchata and chips were also excellent. The atmosphere here makes the food even more authentic. Lots of friendly people eating great food. 

Don't go to the mission district for mexican food. Come. Here.
author: Keegan S.

description: Try this place awhile ago. It was pretty good, you could tell when all the people that there coming. Love food that is just simple and good.
author: Monet A.

description: I've been to this location for many years since it opened, but as of late the quality has been taking a dip. I ordered by phone a Plato de pollo asado and told the server if the pollo had no pepper season on it? They assured me no , but that was not the case. The plate was for my mother who is allergic to pepper (black pepper) $16 wasted and dissatisfied.
author: Elias S.

description:
Been to this spot twice since it got the new name. A few weeks ago I had a super taco. It was satisfying but the guacamole was runny, kinda looked like it got pushed out of a tube. This last weekend went in and ordered a carne asada suiza. It was mostly cheese. Small! I've usually not able to finish a while suiza. I finished this easy. Had a stomach ache afterwards. 

Two people I was with ordered nachos. Hardly any meat. Mostly cheese. They also had stomach aches after eating. I will not be returning here.
author: Monica O.

description: The best hole in the wall authentic Mexican food you'll ever have! I ordered a super steak burrito today and I was not disappointed as usual. It's bursting with flavor, the meat is cut up and cooked nicely and their salsa bar has everything from mild to wild! I always recommend this taqueria because it's honestly the best in the Bay Area. I'm so glad they're located a few blocks away from my house.
author: Lupe R.

description: Ok, I have never paid so much for a carne asada torta or a bowl of pozole before!  The carne asada torta was almost 10 bucks and it was around 12 bucks for a bowl of pozole.  But it's San Francisco these are reasonable prices.  "ok.  This better be good a$$ food!"  The lady at the register was super kind and the establishment was clean and relatively empty.   complimentary chips and salsa (yeeeaaaasss!), is always welcomed. the salsa bar had about 3 variations of salsa and toppings, all of which appeared fresh.   The torta was the first to arrive; hot off the grill, bread warm and toasted,  some mayo, fresh lettuce, and filled with flavorful carne asada (perfectly cut and very small amount of gristle or fat.  After eating half the sandwich I began to regret ordering a full bowl of pozole. That is until the pozole was placed before me and I could smell the delicious aroma.  The broth was perfect, just enough lean pork and a side of veggies and tostada to sweeten the deal.  Throughout the meal observed the locals and the frequenters coming in and their friendly interaction with the staff.  Mexico Tipico is a cozy place that serves delicious and fresh homemade food.
author: Mary Ann C.

description: Worst place ever so i had ordered 3 tacos and towards the end i decided to add 1 more. So they went ahead and took meat outve the 3 tacos that where already made to make 1 more. They charged me full price of a taco for just 2 tortilla even after i told them i just saw what they had done.
author: Ruben A.

description: The food is always so good and the staff so friendly, plus it's in my neighborhood, so why go elsewhere? On weekends their menudo and posole are wonderful, the broth clean and tasty, and for the menudo the tripe well cleaned. Their burritos are so generously filled that I'm hard-pressed to finish one. While I'm partial to their lengua, their cabeza-filled are tasty too. For tacos I love their grilled fish. If this place were more authentic it would be in Mexico.
author: William G.

description: Friendly service and good decent Mexican food with a menu that has a few unusual items that you don't see everywhere. But while it's perfectly ok, it's really not any more outstanding food-wise than many other local places. Just a bit pricey too.
author: Tom B.

description: I got the quesadilla here and it was alright. Food is okay. Service is good. Price is normal. The nice thing is that there is not a line here and it's close by. If you don't feel like making a trek to any other taqueria, this is a solid choice!
author: Eva C.

description: Carne asada Burrito and quesadilla were really good! Nice and juicy. The cost was just about the same as anything else you would find in the mission. Only downside is you have to tell the workers how many salsa containers you want, you have to ask for the chips and the quesadillas were a bit smaller than what you would get at Guadalajara.
author: Melissa M.

description: I came here, out of curiosity trying to find some good food. I ordered an Enchilada plate, which was about $13.00. It was very worth it &' I have been coming back here ever since.
author: A'Niya M.

description: Friendly service, plenty of parking, good food, opens til midnight, bars nearby, try the tacos and al pastor burrito
author: G L.

description: Love this spot, my wife and I always decide between here and Guadalajara taqueria in the Excelsior.  They have different styles and they are each better at different types of meat and dishes.  But service and attention to your order is always of up most importance to them.  Seems like they've been around for a long time, keep doing what you do!  Thank you!
author: Bill H.

description: Found another taqueria and didn't expect much but was surprised at how everything was so flavorful. We had the omelette with chorizo, shrimp quesadilla, and shrimp burrito. I really like the first two and would definitely order them again.
author: Minh H.

description:
I've tried a lot of the taquerias on Mission St. (and there are a lot) but this one is my favourite; yes even better than El Farolito.

This place has the best burrito and the best quesadilla in SF:
Super burrito (carne asada) with everything on it. 
Super quesadilla (chicken) with everything on it. 

Mexico Tipico also has the consistency down. I've been here probably a dozen or so times and every time the burrito or quesadilla turns out being just as good as the last time I was here.

After ordering it does take some time to get your meal but it's always fresh, hot, and worth the wait. You can eat the free chips and salsa while you are waiting.
author: Tom P.

description:
Arrived for early lunch at about 11:00am. Parking was easy to find, the dining room was sparsely populated. A server clocked in while I was eating.

It is true--the lengua here has a depth of beefiness Taq' Guads does not have. It has a more velvety mouthfeel...melting like a meaty terrine, and it exudes a collagen rich nectar that has you licking your lips and fingers.

I chose the Super Burrito. Good, but the other ingredients were simply distractions from the lengua. Each time I bit into a knot of chunked lengua, I collided with a moment of euphoria. On retrospect, the other reviewers were absolutely correct-- the regular burrito would showcase the lengua far better. 

The salsas were also a notch up in authenticity. Somehow, the chilies and herbs were edgier and had greater contrast. I was practically drinking the creamy avocado enriched salsa verde and I liked blending the salsa roja with the bright green tomatillo salsa. They serve a tortilla chip here that is puffy--I prefer the translucent thin variety.

The large TV might have been tuned to Telemundo? A football (soccer to America) match was going that had the attention of just about every guest in the room.

Watching the man behind the counter craft each order with immense pride was a great fun. He often hung back to watch us devour our food with a satisfied grin--almost like being fed by family.

All the staff were attentive and uber friendly--they glance at you periodically as they moved about the restaurant to see if you need anything. They were very patient with me and eager to answer my questions. The place is alive with Spanish speakers with broad economic diversity. I chose to speak English the entire time I was there. By the time my meal was ending, I half expected to walk out to a dusty litter lined-street and white painted tree trunks in Mexico.

I am looking forward to my return. When I do, I shall have to order a taco trio of the other meats--chorizo, carnitas and tripas just to see how they stack up.


ADDENDUM 6/19/2016--the trio of tacos was educational. The chorizo is the typical, red tinted greasy tangy mess that is satisfying as it is messy. The Carnitas is good with moist chunky bits of caramelized flesh. The Tripas is actually very good with crunchy crackling bits and creamy clean interiors--no barnyard after flavors. I would suggest that you ask for the salsa on the side as the salsa is distracting for all three meats. A spritz of lime would have done it.

At the end of the day, the lengua reigns supreme here.
author: Lu-Shien T.

description:
Decided to come here on a Sunday night to get some takeout. I was a little tired of the usual places I go to and so I decided to venture off to the Excelsior. It was one of the best decisions I made that day. I got two super burritos, (al pastor, carne asada), order of ceviche and two churros (regular and caramel filled). 
The meat is super juicy and tasty, the rice and beans inside the burrito was flavorful. Overall, it was a very solid burrito. The burrito was a fair size and I wasn't overly stuffed. The ceviche was DELICIOUS. It was acidic, tangy, and a very nice spicy kick to it. I preferred the regular churro as opposed to the caramel filled one because the latter was a little too sweet. The churros remained crispy throughout the car ride which was very impressive. 
The service wasn't the fastest even though it didn't look too busy (might of been a bunch of phone orders) . This place was well worth commute from the Sunset district and I look forward to coming here again!
author: Henry M.

description:
I went here on a Friday night having dinner with family. I heard a lot of great reviews from family's raving about the food coming from this restaurant is so good. So I better try it, it was a Friday night and of course, a lot of family and friends eating here having a good time. It is busy after 5 pm. Of course, a lot of customers are ordering anything seafood like shrimp cocktails, molcajete. Then some people are ordering combo plates like tacos, burritos and a lot of great cocktails to go with it. The ambiance here is so lively and casual. The waiting staff are so friendly, courteous and are very professional.
We ordered the following:
Molcajete de Camarones - it is a sizzling molcajete filled with grilled seafood like shrimp, scallops, mussels, clams and crab legs. They put a butter garlic sauce and is not overpowering. My sister in law saw this at the other table but I think she ordered the regular size which is $25. There is a bigger one which cost $41 and has the specialty like the one I saw with Mark Wiens ate at one of the restaurants offer there, but they added seafood. So it is a bigger molcajete (a stone mortar that is sizzling hot filled with grilled flank steak, some seafood like shrimp, crab legs, scallops, grilled and charred Nopales hanging over at one side, onions and some sauce with it. It was sizzling hot. There are sides of rice and refried beans, and your choice of tortillas. This is a showstopper, and it was good like 3.9/5. $22.
Huaraches is pretty simple but flavorless dish because it is just corn masa deep fried filled with shredded beef, sour cream, tomatoes, onions, and guacamole. Bleh!!!... Not the best I had! 1.3/5. $8.75.
My brother got the enchiladas and flautas combo plate with some Mexican rice and refried beans. It was satisfyingly good like their enchiladas sauce is great and had some flavor - 3.8/5. $15.95.
I ordered the Gallina de Mole - so basically it is a rich sauce that is made from scratch and so flavorful with chicken thighs that are soft and perfectly cooked. The mole negro is made with chiles, spices, almonds, sesame seeds, carbs, cinnamon. I mean this sauce is rich and so flavorful served with a side of refried beans and Mexican rice, and hot corn tortillas. In my opinion, I had tasted better Mole but coming from a restaurant - this was great. I only ate 1/2 of it and was too full because of the sides. Their mole is worth it if you just want to explore and try what mole really is. I would rate this as 4.2/5. If I had a choice of beans like black beans - then this dish will be better in terms of texture and combinations of ingredients and flavors. If you eat any rich and spicy food here, always get an iced cold beer or horchata to go with it. The horchata here is not too sweet as in other restaurants. But I liked the slight sweetness, cinnamon of a cold rice drink. The prices are normal in the East Bay Area and it is dinner time. $19.
The service here is great especially serving customers on a Friday night and I think it is payday for most customers here. And of course, a lot of Hispanic customers ordering seafood because it is Friday and near Lent season. So yeah! it is expected.
Their shrimp cocktail is filled with clam juice, a lot of shrimp ceviche, and a lot of avocados which gives it the creamy texture and great combination. Their cocktail is on the sweet balanced side with lime wedges overhanging the rim of the glass. Then few folks here ordered Margarita to go with it. As if you were at the beach eating it. So their menu is so diverse, and a lot of variety here. The prices here are on the higher average range like $9 to $41. Drinks are $3 to $10.Appetizers are $6 to $9. Desserts are $6. 
If you were to come here for great Mexican food that tastes like home and want authentic - this is the place. But expect prices ranging from $6 to $41. A lot of variety of dishes they serve. Here are their specialties, Molcajete combo plates, their mole negro (Gallina de Mole) and mole pipian (Gallina de Pipian - another type of mole made of tomatillos, pepitas or pumpkin seeds, and poblano peppers). They serve great cocktails here too.
I would come back here for more for a special occasion. In the heart of the East Bay, you can find a restaurant that serves Mexican authentic home cooking that has a passion for great food with great people serving you with lively and vibrant personalities, and smiles.
author: Jade M.

description: Came here a few times and every time I leave with a smile on my face and a happy belly. I always get a carne asada burrito and it never disappoints. The meat is fresh and they are not cheap on guacamole. They also have XL cups for their drinks too, which is great when you're super thirsty. This place is definitely my favorite taqueria in the Excelsior district.
author: Julian Y.

description: Ok food. Nothing unique stands out. Same standard burrito and taco place. Agua fresca was not so fresca had to ask for a Jarrito instead, glad I said something they soon dumped out their whole Tamarindo agua fresca. Very nice and friendly staff.
author: Alma I.

description:
Great Mexican diner. Seems to be a lot of people eating there or getting to go at 4:30 on a Sunday. 

Tried the shrimp ceviche in a giant cup, birria de res, and a burrito. Shrimp cup had too much ketchup - otherwise it was delicious with plenty of avocado slices, good shrimp, fresh tomatoes.

Also loved the homemade chips!

One thing that is confusing - I don't know if this is really a $ especially for this area. I'd consider it $$
author: Ke D.

description:
This is definitely one of the many hole-in-the-wall hidden gems in San Francisco. 

My friend from out of town wanted to get some Mexican food last night and I was trying to think of a Taqueria that A. I am not sick of, B. doesn't have what I referred to as "fake chips" (El Farolito) but is also good and authentic. It was a toss up between Menudo and Tipico. I know I have been to both, but not recently enough to remember. 

We walked past Tipico and I felt a little embarrassed to take her in there because it looked super dead and not extremely welcoming and then we walked past Menudo and the woman working inside kind of gave us a stink eye (which might not have been intended- I have resting bitch face too so I don't judge). I hopped on Yelp and saw my girl Cherylynn's rave review of Tipico and the choice was made. 

My girlfriend ordered a wet burrito with shredded chicken and I ordered the enchiladas. The cashier who takes your order was so friendly and when my girlfriend asked if there were onions in the wet burrito she said yes in the pico and guac. She could see the stressed-out look on my friend's face that completely read "but guac though..."so she said, "would you like us to just put avocado instead of guacamole?" SO NICE. They seriously put at least half an avocado on her burrito. 

The lady asked me what kind of meat I wanted in my enchiladas so I said "can I have one steak and one grilled chicken" and she said "yes, and what about the other one?" THREE?!?! Wow, talk about generous portions, only $9.95! 

Everything was a homerun from the enchilada sauce to the guacamole to the rice and beans. I also really liked how they put shredded lettuce, a nice RIPE slice of tomato and a dollop of both crema and guac on the plate. I feel like nowadays you hardly ever find places that do that anymore, everything is extra (i'm looking at you Santa Rosa Taqueria -_-)

Great service, real chips, great food, salsa bar, great prices. She may not look like much but she's a keeper.
author: Emma H.

description: Extremely disappointed and taken advantage of. Made my selection of restaurants to get my carnitas and al pastor tacos and what I got was waaaaaay over charged, my al pastor was not al pastor but this cheap crap meat and my carnitas was half of that cheap crap meat and a little bit of carnitas. And they had me waiting forever. No doubt to defrost their shitty meat and serve it to me. Never ever ever again
author: Enilda R.

description:
The ratings do not lie... 

This has got to be the best menudo place in SF, probably better than El Tomate on 24th street. I'm usually used to Mexican places with just canned tripe and a microwave but to my amazement there was a whole friggin foot in my soup. Not only was here tripe but there was fat galore! Best meal to eat after a heavy night of drinking.

Actually everything is good including their Micheladas... The travel is absolutely worth it.
author: Nathan D.

description:
This is probably one of my favorite burrito go-to spots that I've lost track of how many times I've been here! It's more flavorful than Guadalajara & has a better meat to rice ratio than El Farolito.

- Lengua Burrito: Very tender, lots of flavors, & not too much rice yet still very filling. I usually eat half and save the other half for later.
- Quesadilla Suiza de Carne Asada: very crispy, flavorful, & lots of cheesy goodness!
- Alambre the Res (grilled beef with bacon, peppers, & onions): I ordered this since I overheard someone say it was his favorite thing to order here. It was very greasy & salty plus you can see the pool of bacon oil. Not for me, there's plenty other items on the menu that's more appetizing to me.

It's usually packed but not too hard to find a seat since people don't stay too long. Just very efficient eating while catching a game on tv. There's sometimes a bit of a wait so call in your to-go order. If you're doing takeout, don't worry yourself about getting salsa. The lady gives you 1 red salsa & 1 green salsa from the refrigerator. The green tomatillo sauce is really good. I normally ask that they switch out my red sauce for the green one.

I've yet to try out the Menudo & Pozole which are only available on the weekends. Regardless of how busy they are, the cashier is always friendly & all smiles :)
author: Ruby C.

description: I am perplexed at all the high reviews of this place. The prices are typical of San Francisco and the burrito I had was simply average. Again there was nothing wrong with the food or service it just didn't strike me as anything out of the ordinary. I will note they were quite busy and it was hard to find a table on Saturday afternoon when I visited. So perhaps this does say something about the place.
author: Robert C.

description: The green posole soup with chicken is delicious! Tastes very "homemade". The menudo was tasty but a bit too flavorful for me.
author: Dan B.

description:
Ah, the less popular and less busy Mexican option on Mission in the Excelsior. There's Guadalajara AND Farolito's a few blocks down so in contrast, this place hides in the shadows..
I've been a frequent customer at Guadalajara for a few years now and I didn't really even know about this place (or care to know about it..) I happened to be doing some Yelp research as my friend wanted Mexican food near his place, and I found that I had bookmarked Tipico a while ago.

I bookmarked this place to try the menudo but that's only available on weekends.. GUESS I'LL HAVE TO COME BACK. I opted for the al pastor burrito instead so I could compare it with Guadalajara's.

** COMPARED TO GUADALAJARA **
Venue: smaller, and gives kinda the same gritty, casual restaurant vibe (but not dirty, by any means). Seating shouldn't be too difficult as many people just scarf their food down and bounce.

Salsas: Self-serve and pretty standard. All seems to be home-made and the spicy salsas DEFINITELY have a kick. I like-y. Guadalajara's green sauce is bomb though and nothing can compare to that... they don't have a similar sauce here :(

Chips *free w/ order: They seem to be house-fried (not hot ) - crispy and on the thicker side. SO FREAKIN ADDICTING. Tastes more flour based than corn based (probably why it's so addicting).. not oily on the fingers.

Wait time: Seems longer than Guadalajara. Waited like 15 minutes for my burrito. SO HUNGRY. At least they give you chips though :)

Burrito: In a nutshell: delicious, not too much rice, KIND of soggy and not warm to the touch (the sour cream/guac makes it feel a bit cold, actually) - but the taste factor makes up for the last 2 things.

LOOKED a bit small but it was a beast. FULL of filling and not too much rice (don't you hate it when you pay for a burrito and all you get is rice?!) Even distribution of filling. A bit soggy for my liking though (I think it's b/c they put the pico de gallo in it already) and you definitely don't need to add any salsa to it as it's flavorful enough. Super flavorful and cooked well but doesn't feel heavy. Tastes more 'tomatoey' than Guadalajara. 

I don't remember what my friend got, but it was basically a chicken + rice + beans dish which came with tortillas (and they give you a plastic cover thing so the tortillas stay warm!). Meat is definitely on the oilier side, but MAN, was it tender and flavorful.... shitton of food for $10.

Glad I came here! Will definitely return to try the menudo and some other burritos =)
Will definitely frequent this establishment more!
author: Emily C.

description:
I didn't think it would happen.
I didn't think I'd give 5 stars to another taqueria on mission street.
So far, that's been reserved only for La Taqueria.

But life can, & will, surprise you.

Being dissatisfied w Taqueria Guadalajara every time, I opted to try Tipico.  

It seemed, from my Yelp friends, that by my taking this adventurous risk, I might be rewarded w some straight up unbelievably fresh & delicious tacos.

And rewarded I was.

My fish tacos were positively 5 stars.  The fish was fresh, tender, full of flavor, & cooked to perfection.

Just the right amount of dressing.  Enough to add moisture & flavor, without overpowering the tacos.  Too much would kill the whole thing.  They nailed it.

And the lettuce?  If you told me they had just picked the lettuce from a garden in the back & shredded it 2 minutes before they filled my order, I'd totally believe it.

These tacos only reinforced my confusion as to why Guadalajara is so highly rated.

My man ordered the carne asada burrito.  He loved & inhaled it accordingly.  I did get 2 bites, & they were delicious.  There was a kick in the sauce, the steak was tender, & it was full of flavor.

The chips, however, are completely forgettable.  As are the salsas.

But the food?  Outstanding quality, freshness, & flavor.  Love, love, love.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: I have had a couple of experiences here. The first was a little lacking on the service front, but that's fine. The second time -- five days ago -- resulted in two of the three of us throwing up all night (the third had soup - the benefits of boiling!). We all had to compare notes about the respective situations -- pork quesadilla and fish tacos were both culprits. Pozole was fine, but my advice is to avoid this place on many fronts. I honestly couldn't believe that pork and fish were both implicated. There are much better places on this stretch of Mission Street, so please, explore beyond here.
author: Vincent R.

description: So lucky this place is nearby.  Honestly this is the best SF has to offer and this city is famous for burritos.  Order anything and everything I haven't been let down by anything but then not having enough seats.
author: Tom B.

description: First time going and let me say that was the best customer service I've experience at a restaurant in a while. Viviana was so nice and very friendly. I told her it was my time there and she made my experience something to remember. I ordered a grilled chicken burritos and it was AMAZING and the green sauce was super good! Viviana even gave us a free churro. She was the sweetest! Thanks girl I'll definitely be coming back! ;)
author: Crystal S.

description:
I thought this would be my new go-to place after seeing all the reviews and pictures but this place is just A-OK. 

I had ordered a super grilled chicken burrito with no rice and no beans and we also ordered a super lengua burrito with no beans. They make everything fresh so it too awhile for us to get our order. This may sound weird but my burrito was TOO saucy and it made it very heavy for me to eat. They put way too much sour cream and cheese in it and I swear all the meat was on the bottom where I couldn't really eat the burrito anymore. Once I reached the bottom I just used a spoon to scoop out the chicken cause I didn't want the sauce. I must say their green salsa is pretty good though, as well as their chips. Their chips are different from other places, they are light, crispy and not oily at all which I liked. As for the lengua burrito the meat was okay...it was a bit too chewy. 

While we were waiting for our order I did see a lady hand making their tortillas which was pretty awesome, I think if I do come back next time I will order some tacos.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Good place to grab a quesadilla or burrito if you are in the Excelsior District!

The place is somewhat small so if you are looking for seating I would suggest you get here before lunch time. Once lunch time rolls around this place can get packed rather quickly.

The menu is good. A nice mixed selection of your usual items. They also include chips and salsa along with your order which I am starting to realize is not common in all Mexican restaurants.

Because this place gets so busy you may find yourself waiting for awhile for your food. Not sure if they take over the phone orders but expect to wait for a bit. When I was there they only had 2 cooks at the time working so just be patient and watch the TV.

I paid cash but I believe that they accept credit/debit card as well.

I food was good once I finally sat down. I had ordered a carnitas burrito and it was cool. It seemed a bit dry even though there was a mix of guacamole, cheese, and sour cream. 

The burrito was very filling but I just would've liked for the burrito to have had a bit more flavor. Oh well, I will still give this place another try just because the food was good. I would recommend coming here around 11:30 am. 

#chipsandsalsa
author: Robert F.

description: Excellent!  Delicious molé chicken.  Generous chicken tacos.  Authentic chicken Pozole.  Huge portions.  Higher priced than most taquerias, but so much food - will just share plates next time.  Total for 3 dishes, free chips and two sodas was $41.28 + tip
author: Scuba J.

description: Super good , fast and good service! Not from around here.. so I recommend it for a quick authentic mexican food !
author: Angel S.

description:
I come here usually on a weekday morning when there's not many customers and the lady clerk is soooo nice, courteous, and gets orders right!!  I asked for lots of lettuce on my burrito and not only did I get it fast within 10 minutes but they got the custom order of lettuce right!!  

Their food is sooooo good, so saucy, tasty, not dry like a lot of other burritos in the city - here, the burrito is hot, saucy and eats like a meal and is big!!!  I was surprised too with the chips- I would have thought they would just toss some old cold yucky chips to the order but no,the chips looked pretty fresh and heated and tasted fresh, warm, crunchy.  I wondered where the sauce for the chips were and was told you have to go to the area with the sauces (to the right of the clerk's counter) to choose from the various salsa and/or guacamole sauce(s) you want to accompany your chips.  I couldn't tell what each one tasted like just by looking at them so I got 3 tiny empty sauce bowls and filled them up with a different sauce.  Texture and heat spiciness were different for each.

And finally, their aqua frescas  are fresh, cool, not too sweet, refreshing with a selection of cantaloupe, tamarind, horchata, strawberry) .  

What's also great is they ACCEPT CC or debit cards!!!  How refreshing!! (Hello la corneta taqueria, taqueria cancun, el gran taco loco, etc!!! --- no one's going to DRAIN their wallets of $15 or more of cash all the time just to get a drink and a burrito!!!) 

The restaurant is clean and pretty spacious with 4 or so medium tables(each table fitting 4 people) on one side and 3 small tables(if you're by yourself) on the other side.  You're lucky if you find street parking - better to come by bus.
author: Frugal C.

description: Everything we have eaten here is great.  Definitely go for the pastor!  The flavor is incredible and juicy.  Also the light green creamy salsa is so good!
author: vlad k.

description:
Hard to find street parking, so I could imagine it can sometimes be difficult to get though. But you'll be glad you did. 

Definitely not as much buzz as your El Farolitos, but give this place a chance. Has good Mexican atmosphere and like most burrito places, they make it right in front you. Cashier was quick and friendly. 

Got the Pozole, super lengua burrito, and carne asada burrito mojado. All to go. Fast and easy pick up.

Pozole - Legit. Had my first try of pozole in Mexico, and it was damned good. This was just as I remember it. I think it is only weekend option here, so look out for it then. The broth is flavorful and savory. Doesn't leave a greasy feeling in your mouth. Meat is tender and crumbles in the mouth. They give you tostadas, but I didn't use em.

Super Burrito Lengua - The meat to toppings ratio was just right. As with most "super," you get the sour cream and guacamole. It was my first time trying lengua. Succulent, tender... but lacks a little flavor. Much better when added hot sauce.

Mojado - Did not dig the sauce. Tastes almost like an italian tomato sauce. A little  bit counterintuitive for this dish. Carne asada however was great!

I'm going to come back. But I'm going to try what I know best: carne asada super burritos. Then we'll see how this place holds up. And possibly rank higher
author: Edward L.

description:
Came here for burritos but their rice plates and ceviche looked amazing... gotta try it next time.

My burrito: Generous on the meat and well cooked tortilla wrap (not burnt and greasy). Seriously a good tortilla wrap makes a huge difference. Not so much avocado but many tacquerias skip out on that so... Anyway, try the super burrito with extra salsa. 

Bonus: cashier was sweet & smiled! Rarely see that at tacquerias lol. The place is spacious, which is a plus.
author: Gloria L.

description: Not good at all. The meat is horrendous. They chop it into small.pieces and grill it until it's charred to the point off being tiny rock like bits that you constantly need to spit out. Beans are watered down too much making the entire experience like eating rocks out of a puddle. Other than that, if they fixed these two issues, it would be good.
author: H K.

description:
Decent service, decent food
Price: I ordered the carne asada super nachos with everything which came to a total of under $10. I was impressed to see that the prices were lower than the other taquerias in the area. 
Flavor: sour cream, guacamole, nacho cheese sauce, another type of cheese, and care Asama topped a bed of chips. It was flavorful but I wish it had a bit more seasoning and included a refreshing component like lettuce or tomatoes. Maybe I'm just being picky and a nacho snob. Chip to topping ratio is on point and the beef isn't tough.
I would definitely come again to get a burrito or quesadilla.
author: Connie C.

description:
My lady copped a super carne Asada burrito extra sour cream.. She loved it.

I wanted something different and went with the alambres.. Was tasty and all but wish I would've went lighter with the cheese. Nonetheless it did not take away from the taste of the beef! Tasty dish and a huge portion for $9.95.

Food was great. SALSAS WERE BOMB. Beats Guadalajara and Farolito easily. Underrated and deserves a lot more recognition. For once I witnessed someone equally distribute the sour cream across the burrito..

OH The young lady with the blonde hair and hoops was awesome! Asked to Refill our chips.. Yeah she asked if she can refill our chips.. For FREE. Where they do that at?? 


We'll be back.
author: Carlos R.

description: My new favorite Mexican spot! The staff is extremely friendly, and the food is amazing! Plus they're usually open late which is convenient. With your order you get chips, and they have a salsa bar with great salsa! There is a bathroom for customers, as well as free water. There's usually parking when I go, but I usually go late. My favorite thing are their normal tacos with carne asada and green sauce.
author: Courtney A.

description: one of my favorite places in the mission!!! come here often and the workers are sooo nice to me. great authentic place with good burritos, tacos, and CHILLAQUILES !!!!!!!!!
author: Sasha G.

description:
Came here tonight and ordered two carne asada tacos and one flour quesadilla. 
Tacos were okay, they were filled with meat which was nice for the price but they were not flavorful. Maybe because it was Sunday night. 

The quesadilla was bomb. Filled with a lot of cheese and melted to just right temperature. 

Overall, I would definitely come here again for the quesadilla and I'd consider trying the tacos again just not on a Sunday night.
author: Serena S.

description: After living in San Diego for a year, I have been trying to find an establishments here in San Francisco that's comparable. This is it! Close enough anyway. And oh the tortilla chips are so friggin fresh!!!
author: H C.

description:
Came here tonight with the hubby because we were in the area and craving a burrito. We both wanted to go to Guadalajara because it's our absolute favorite, but then I remembered that a bunch of people said this place was better and had to try it out of pure curiosity. We ordered one super burrito with grilled chicken and another with carne asada and then got some salsas from the salsa bar. Their selection isn't as extensive as the other place, but it was decent. We waited a really long time for our food and felt like people who arrived after us got their food before us, but I was fine with that as long as the burritos were good. 

When we got home I took a bite and felt the ingredients weren't as evenly distributed as they could have been, but both the rice and meat had really good flavor. I was a little disappointed because there was no avocado and the burrito was smaller than expected, but it was good and got the job done. What I really liked was the salsa verde because it had this citrusy/tangy flavor that was amazing! 

Would I say this is better than Guadalajara? No, but it's a nice second option and I can see why people like it.
author: Steph L.

description: Walked in on a Monday ..Mid Day.. service was great, nice welcoming, very cozy.. Food was delicious. it brought back a feeling as if my mom was cooking. It is a family owned restaurant and you could feel it in the air. Ordered there Spicy Red Chilaquiles. They were crispy, hot and delicious.. enjoyed eating here
author: Alana R.

description: Tasty #13 Filete de pescado.    Sautéed in butter with freshly made corn tortillas, fresh avocado slices, and really good salsa from salsa bar.
author: Joseph S.

description: It is one of my favorite taqueria in the area the staff is always helpful. Fast and friendly service. The food is delicious you can not go wrong with anything that is ordered from here. I am here about twice a week.
author: Bre M.

description: Delicious burritos. The best old school authentic tacqueria in the excelsior. Love this place so much.
author: Rosa A.

description: Fast and friendly service. Had the shrimp fajitas and they were delicious. Have a michelada while you're there!
author: Fernando G.

description: This spot is delicious. The food is cooked just right. Red sause is spicy and the green is just as good. I have the breakfast today and I have been here for a late night bite. Both times smile on my face and a full belly. The prices are perfect.
author: A M.

description: Depends on who is cooking but for the most part, I love this place have been coming here for a few years now. I would recommend this spot versus the other taqueria's in the neighborhood.
author: Brian N.

description: In my first time being in this restaurant I just came by to check out this place since I am not from around this place. Came by and got their super burrito and it was very good. People were nice, friendly, a bit pricey but way better than Chipotle. All an all great place to eat at.
author: Auriel J.

description: Came here for the fish tacos and was not let down! These guys give Rubios a run for their money!!  Just ask for Ruben  or Mary two very friendly  staff members!!
author: Curtis L.

description:
Situation: Sunday morning. I woke up before my bf and had an insane craving for pozole. I quickly jumped on Yelp to investigate the pozole situation in our area. Mexico Tipico stood out amongst the options. As soon as the bf woke up, I was there to sweet talk him into joining me. 

As promised there were two kinds of pozole that were only available on the weekend (red and green). I saw a family of 4 with two bowls of each kind of pozole and I awkwardly hovered over them, trying to hide the fact that I was sneaking peaks at their meals so that I could determine which kind to get. Ultimately, I went for the red pozole and the bf went with the chicken mole poblano. Holy cow, they were both insane. The pozole came out piping hot and full of meaty pork chunks (not just lots of pork bones like at other places) and hominy, and the broth had a rich deep flavor. It came with accoutrements of onions, lemon, radishes, cabbage, which I promptly dumped into the bowl. My bf took a picture of me happily slurping away and sent it to his mother. How embarrassing. Anyway, there was so much that I ended up having to take it to go and eat it for dinner! Boyfriend's chicken mole was also delish - chicken was tender, mole was sweet but not too sweet. 

The prices were reasonable, portion sizes were generous, and service met all expectations. I'll definitely be back to try the green pozole.
author: Janet Z.

description:
Good prices,good healthy portions and fresh ingredients my go to place for when the I don't feel like cooking....
Chile rellenos are spicy delicious cheesy goodness, quesadillas and carne asada are my fav 3 options
author: Wendy C.

description:
Luck is luck, right? Well I must have hit the jackpot because I live two blocks away from Mexico Tipico. How do I love thee? Let me count the ways...

1) Massive. Awesome. Burritos. Yeah, yeah, yeah. Burritos are to SF as Delis are to NYC. I get it. Ask any SF resident where the best place to get a big ass burrito is and you are bound to find yourself in a lively and possibly violent debate. Well, Mexico Tipico is mine. Let the debate ensue. 

2) They take cards!!! They do! With no limit! And no, this is not a mirage. Swipe away.

3) Nicest staff. Even over the phone! I've seen the same lady with a line 10 deep of people waiting to order and surrounded by 20 people who are waiting with the "hangry" eyes for their food pick up the phone with CHEER in her voice. Cheer, people!

4) Tacos. Soup. Fish. Everything is great, fresh, flavorful, and affordable.

Check it out and thank me later.
author: Katie N.

description:
3.5 stars

i've tried their quesadilla suiza, carnitas.  i love how they stuff it with lots of meat, not all cheese.  but i think i still prefer La Guadajalara or El Farolito's quesadilla.  Verdict not over yet.  
my husband likes super burrito with carne asada
Maybe it's just me but the food needs to be hotter. 
chips are fresh, yummm
Place kinda has the old rug smell, but clean enough.
author: Claire J.

description: Order at the counter and take a seat...I love the lengua tacos. Breakfast of chilaquiles is delicious, too...and we love the horchata.  Service is friendly.
author: Geri S.

description: Best pozole in town! We have tried their red pozole as well as the green one, very well served and the flavor is amazing. Their chips are delicious and crunchy. My husband loves their menudo too. Definitely coming back!
author: Suzy R.

description: My first time here and I'm a native in this neighborhood....I came in during lunchtime and I asked if they are still serving breakfast and the cashier lady said it ended at noon so I ordered 2 tacos pastor and asada plus fried tilapia... the meat is so small and thin and then these 2 non Latinos folks came in asked for breakfast and the cashier lady said about 4 or 5 menu items is ok to order from the breakfast menu.. I wanted one of those breakfast menus!! Never again coming here and I guess I won't speak Spanish when I order food.  If you want good ass meat tacos go to La Corneta or La Taqueria!
author: Teena H.

description:
Wow this place is great! It's a self-service place and the people working here are very happy to work here. 
 I would definitely recommend the avocado burrito or the super burrito. They were both great. The salsa is spicy and wonderful. 
 I would totally return to this place!
author: Rebecca K.

description: I ordered the super burrito with steak and was quite impressed.  I actually didn't expect anything less.  The food is authentic and you can tell that they take their time in preparing quality food.  My burrito was perfect!  The perfect amount of rice, refried beans, cheese, crema and steak.  The meat was full of flavor and very tender. I ordered to go and my food was ready in less than 10 minutes.  I grabbed a horchata to go with it which was good as well.  I don't think you can mess up horchata.  My order came with what looked like homemade tortilla chips and salsa  but i scarfed down the chips so fast I forgot about the salsa.  They were tasty and seasoned with just the right amount of salt.  The best part of this place is that they have late night hours.  I think I'll go back tonight!
author: Alana I.

description:
Do yourself a favor and order their tacos al pastor, theeee best I have had in the United States.

Other options are good as well, their birria is delicious! I like my food on the salty side, so some might say its salty but for me its perfect.
author: Arlenne D.

description: delicious mole poblano and milanese! cannot wait to come back on a weekend to try the menudo and burria
author: Long C.

description: For what this is, a Taquira, it's definitely a 5 star! Love their mole poblano and I'm addicted.  This is my go to place for delicious Mexican food.  It holds up to all the good reviews! Thanks Yelp!
author: Hieu D.

description:
Convincing Jamie W. to go to the Excelsior for Mexican is no small feat since he is a creature of habit, but when I saw the reviews for the weekend menudo here, I became determined to drive over there and give it a try. This stretch of Mission is a bit dicey even at around 9PM, but I was lucky to find a parking space just a few yards away. We entered to see the yellow and orange place abuzz with activity. It appears to be a favorite with locals since most of the tables were filled. I spotted one table and told Jamie to sit there to stake a claim while I ordered our food.

They have a long photo menu along the wall that was kinda hard to read from my vantage point. Jamie decided on the $7.95 Bistek Ranchero, which was slices of grilled beef mixed with onions and potatoes topped with their special ranchero sauce. It came with rice and refried beans topped with queso fresco (see photo). It was pretty tasty for a hearty appetite, especially since it came with a half-dozen corn tortillas in a plastic bin. As for me, give me the $6.50 bowl of Menudo, prepared traditionally with tripe and beef stomach meat...mmm-mmm (rubbing my protuding belly).

It takes hours to simmer, and they added some chili paste to give it a rich red color. It comes with all sorts of spices on the side - dried oregano and crushed red chili peppers - along with a wedge of lime, chopped onions and chopped cilantro (see photos). Dump it all into the red broth and you have the perfect late-night treat, hangover be damned. The ambiance is quite lively with cute little girls in pink outfits playing next to us (see photo) as a group of slackers chow down at a nearby table. A return trip for that menudo is certainly warranted.

FOOD - 4 stars...the menudo is quite something here
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...cheap tables with buckling floors but a lot of good people-watching here
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...very nice and they refilled our chips basket without us asking
TOTAL - 4 stars...menudo is such tripe and doesn't have anything to do with Ricky Martin
author: Ed U.

description: This is probably one of the best overlooked taquerias in SF. Everything is always fresh and flavorful - I always go with their tacos and sopes. Im not a big fan of their burritos as they taste average to me, I recommend going with anything else. The portions are bigger than most other places. Their rice is even amazing.
author: Richard L.

description:
There are a few taquerias around here. I was famished and tried to decide which one I wanted.

I walked by Mexico Tipico, and the customers and staff were smiling inside so I picked this place. The staff was friendly, and my burrito came fast. The salsa is the reason for the 5 stars. It was spicy enough to be interesting, but not so spicy it was painful. 

Overall a good experience if you're looking for a tasty taqueria in the Excelsior.
author: Charles S.

description: Everything we have tried here is great. Chili Relleno, so popular it sells out at lunch. Mole is so good, my husband talks about wanting to order it and rice for a snack.  Everything is made fresh in front of you.
author: Tina D.

description: Incredible enchilada plate!! The beans are out of this world and the enchiladas themselves are so delicious! The lady at the cash register was very kind and friendly (: 10/10 would come back and if you haven't gone yet, you should!
author: Mio W.

description: This is one of the best spots in this neighborhood. Line gets a bit crazy, sometimes they charge you for extra salsas, but it's great. If you lie around here, imo, tikpico and Farolito and the best/only places to go. Awesome service and some of the nicest people in town make the dining experience even better!  Try the plates for a filling change of pace from the average burrito or super quesadilla. See you guys soon!
author: Julian S.

description: My new favorite burrito place in the neighborhood, beating out Guadalajara and El Farolito. Everything in general - salsas, meats, sauces- is spicier, really spicy actually which suits me just fine. If my nose isn't running it probably could be spicier.
author: S. A. K.

description: Good tacos and that's about all. Slowest service of any taqueria I've been to. If you want to order and get it within 15 minutes then call ahead and when you get there expect to wait another 15 minutes while your food is getting cold. Yelp takes down reviews because it's the truth and because businesses pay them off to do so.
author: Nathaniel S.

description: Come hungry leave full. Every item is fresh and tasty.  The staff is courteous and will accommodate to your tastes. Also the salsa bar is well stocked with wonderful items to put on your chips or entree. Parking can be difficult don't dispare this restaurant is worth the frustration of looking for a parking space.
author: RICHARD M.

description:
The burrito, perfectly swaddled. 
The sauce, perfectly laid. 
I didn't ask to be shown the world. I didn't ask to have the ground swept out from under me. 
I didn't ask to change. 

Mexico Tipico changed me. 

I've been around. I've seen places. People. I've eaten food before. This is not food. This is something so much more. 

A super burrito. That's all I asked for, but it was not all that I was given. I wish I could describe to you in words what was done to me here. But I can't. We don't have words for what happened here... in English, or any other language. All we have are promises. 

I promise you this:
If our world should end tonight, it will not have been in vain. 
Our world made Mexico Tipico. 
All is not yet lost.
author: Abbott N.

description:
This place was a few blocks away from my favorite dispensary, and we were looking to try a New Mexican place on Sunday morning. This place had really favorable reviews on yelp and great photos- do my expectations were probably a little higher than normal.

The decor is fantastic - bright orange and green with autentico masks in the wall. My favorite part was the huge Virgin Guadalupe painting that takes up half of the back wall, and is partially covered up by the flat screen tv showing a futbol game. They have a few copies of bilingual newspapers by the counter too. 

There were a lot of groups there, people waiting to take food to go, and a few solo diners as well. Since there wasn't any seats while we ordered (and it was gloriously sunny outside) we took the food to go.

I ordered steak fajitas, guacamole on the side, and my boyfriend got a chorizo taco. Both were pretty bland, and they had refried beans instead of pinto like in the pictures and in yelp photos. She also forgot my side of guacamole, but the green salsa was to die for. 

I probably wouldn't go back there, there's too many other taquerias in this city to discover. 3 stars because it wasn't bad, just not great either.
author: Kylie F.

description: The food here is really good and this restaurant deserves five stars but the missing star is because the cashier is super rude. She takes your order wrong and when you tell her of the mistake she yells at you. No wonder they are looking for new cashier
author: Isabel G.

description:
The music is god awful... And they play it loud and proud but it's not their fault.

The food is outstanding... Fish burrito grilled to perfection and very fresh with fresh guacamole. Seafood ceviche very fresh and delicious. Fresh  salsa is good. Free nachos.
author: Jingo Django J.

description:
My favorite neighborhood Mexican spot. We pass about 5 other restaurants just to come here. 

I typically get a tongue quesadilla and the tongue is always perfectly cooked.
author: Yelena E.

description: Don't know how this place has 4.5 stars. The most non-authentic Mexican looking and tasting place I've eaten in California. What's worse, the food is hella expensive. A better tasting taco can be found anywhere for a dollar and theirs are five dollars each!! That and the burrito are nothing more than a prepackaged salad mix from Safeway.
author: Shelby Nameless S.

description: While working in the Excelsior district this was one of the 2 places I would go for a burrito. The flavors were great but was amazed I didn't get sick more often due to their cleanness. And also amazed they don't have a lower Health Inspection rating.
author: M C.

description: Hands down the best Mexican restaurant in the area. I was a bit disappointed after I moved to Union City from the lack of quality Mexican restaurants, especially after Mi Pueblo closed. I first visited Mexico Tipico with some co workers for lunch. It's in a small office park which threw me off. The restaurant is medium sized, clean and nicely decorated. I'm partial to the steak fajitas during the week and the Pozole on the weekends. I don't drink but they have a well stocked bar, if that's your thing.
author: Carlos v.

description: Wonderful environment with tasty food. I went with two friends and we all got vegetarian options I got the regular nachos with added lettuce and it was great.
author: Colton W.

description: The lengua super taco is formidable and may actually come with too much sour cream. And I love sour cream. Mexico Tipico is good, but almost next door Menudo is better (the taqueria, not the dish, tho maybe the dish too?).
author: Misha T.

description:
THE BEST HANGOVER CURE: MENUDOOOOOOO!

Most people slurp pho, jook, or devour a greasy plate of hashbrown, eggs and bacon to cure their hangover. I, on the other hand, choose to gnaw on cow stomach and trotters, a "barnyard in a bowl" to rid my hangover. Yup, it's the FOB in me!  

In the last 4 months, I've been coming to Mexico Tipico almost every weekend to get my hands on their bowl of menudo (only served on the weekends) and to satiate my post-drinking ravenous craving for something soupy. 

For a mere $6.50, you get a huge bowl of menudo that's overflowing with honeycomb tripe and trotters (feet) that's gelatinous and so soft that it literally melts-in-your-mouth. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/N_-4AfYmNFKEkvgh3Qj5Eg?select=ZfFkC7Q0m60XSCJZl3MGcQ The red hued broth is rich, comforting, and packed with deep complex flavors with mild chili nuances. It's also accompanied with warm corn tortillas, diced onions, cilantro, lime, red chili pepper flakes and dried oregano. I normally add all the spices for an added layer of heat, tang, and herbaceousness. 

I've tried 3-4 places in SF and Mexico Tipico has the BEST menudo that's consistently good and several dollars cheaper than its competitors which keeps me coming back for more. 

So how exactly does Menudo cure a hangover? It's believed that the tripe/stomach's sponginess will absorb the alcohol in your stomach. Makes sense doesn't it?
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Best burritos and great service. Gets really full often due to the popularity. There isn't any restrooms. The free chips they give out are pretty good as well.
author: Lex A.

description:
Fun little Mexican restaurant with amazing charm. This spot is just a few blocks down from El Farolito, but it's not short for awesome food and great service.

I've ordered the Lengua Avocado burrito and Breakfast burrito. Bring your appetite because these are big and juicy. Some pun intended. With that much meat in your mouth, you'll never leave hungry. Or disappointed. My taste buds were given the salty, greasy treatment necessitated through Mexican food on the Mission. Food comes out quick, and they have fricken breakfast options! Like, legitimate omelettes and potato with toast type breakfast options. Not that you're here for that. But they do. Just another place to add to the main stays of Mexican joints right around this area.
author: Eric L.

description: This place never disappoints.  The weekend chicken pozole is excellent.  And if you're looking for a taco or burrito, you'Il get your fix here too.
author: Heather R.

description: This is our go to place almost every weekend. The Burria and pozole are really good! Everyone is supper nice they recognize you. Are quick and I love how the owner is always part of his team. He is cooking and making sure everything is okay. And everyone there is family too! and plus this is restaurant is owned by my friends uncle so that's a plus ! But I came here before I even knew they where related and I loved it just as much then
author: Kassandra V.

description:
Not sure what else one might want from a taqueria. It's got some stuff competition on this street so it's not getting five stars like Farolito or Cancun but this would be he hands-down champ just about anywhere else on earth. 

Hit the salsa bar while waiting for your super burrito.
author: Martin R.

description: This place is my number one spot now for Mexican food. The michelada is great, the tacos are delicious, rice plates are good, and the service is great. They are super friendly! I love the fact it opens pretty late so I usually come here often at night. :D
author: Jei L.

description:
Great place to grab some burritos around this area. 

What's good:
Super burritos
Tacos

Meh:
The hot salsa could be a bit spicier. 

Con:
Street parking, like everywhere else in SF can be difficult. 

My recommendations:
- go with someone else so that someone can get the food and the other find parking.
Or
Take the bus or lyft there
author: Kat V.

description: I live in the area and this is by far my favorite taqueria. I always get the shrimp and steak burrito. I  absolutely love it with sautéed onions and bell peppers! Staff is always super friendly and I always feel welcomed when I go.
author: Viridiana S.

description: After being out of the states for a week, I was craving some good Mexican food. This place delivered all around. Good food, good service, friendly staff--so much yesssss!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Been living in Excelsior for a little over two years and after trying out the majority of the taco joints in the area, Mexico Tipico is by far my favorite spot. Everything on the menu is fantastic. The super burrito is cheap in price but packed with meat. They do not skimp on the good stuff. 

My only complaint is their tortilla chips. They are not made fresh and come out of a bag. I prefer shops that have hot greasy chips and a well-stocked salsa bar. 

The burritos & tacos though, best in the neighborhood.
author: Dennis C.

description:
Mexico Tipico came highly recommended by Cherylynn N. for their lengua burritos.

decor is minimal with most of the wall space on the left taken by pics of food and the menu. rest of the decor is ethnic. Tipico claims to sell authentic mex. cuisine. must be true. didn't see any gringos here.

eats: lengua (tongue) burrito (4.90+tax)
-tender, slightly flavorful chucks of lengua
-salsa, chips also. salsa bar available
-all ingredients tasted fresh.
-burrito flavoring minimal, self-service flavoring needed.

frijoles refritos:
-food took awhile, cooked to order, came during lunch rush.
-food tasted different, maybe cuz it's authentic, i must be eating the fake stuff all my life.
-only mexicans in da house! whole families of them!
-cash only?
author: Victor G.

description: This place lies! It says they open at 8:00 am, but when I walked in there the guy said they don't open until 8:30. Total waste of my time!!
author: B G.

description:
Just another taqueria in the Excelsior....WRONG.  Came by the district and had a craving for a super burrito thats not el farolito.  Walked in and all the tables either were used up or had plates left to be cleaned.  The cooks were busy cooking and it took about a minute until the lady asked for my order.

I ordered a super lengua burrito and after a very short wait, about 5 minutes she gave me my burrito.  Maybe she thought I was a total newb but she also got me a cup of each salsa from the sauce bar to go with my chips.  I was going to get some after I got my burrito but that was nice of them.  

As for the super lengua burrito, I could actually taste every ingredient.  The ratio of everything was good although I just wished they added a little bit more of everything but thats the greedy hungry side of me.  The lengua was SUPER soft and tender and there wasn't anything really wrong with the burrito.  The salsas had a small kick of spice to it which was good.  Overall, I'm a fan and will definitely come there again.  Would choose this over el farolito.
author: Rob C.

description: As many taco places there are in SF, you know the ones you would go back to and the ones you wouldn't.  I would definitely come back here. The ladies behind the counter were so cute and nice, the chips were homemade and amazing and the red sauce was actually spicy!  I got a Carne a sad a super burrito and it was fantastic! Yum
author: Stacy A.

description: We started to come here bc the place we used to go to changed chefs. We ordered two things: a suiza and burrito (simple order) before the rush of people. It was obvious that they forgot our order. My bf inquired about our order and one of the workers responded to us "hey man, you didn't order any food from here." That's obviously an insult and we felt very disrespected as we live very close to this restaurant. No apology for making us wait for 20 minutes or offer to refund the order. So rude, we're definitely never going there again. Go to La Menudo next door, you won't be disappointed!
author: Kat P.

description: I just tried this place and the food was OUTSTANDING! If you're looking for a fancy place with expensive food and drinks this is NOT the place for you.  It's not pretty, nor is parking convenient, but well worth the hassle. This is truly a gem in my neighborhood when it comes to food. I mean everything was good - the homemade chips, the types of salsa, the beans, the rice - everything had great taste. It really tasted like authentic Mexican food. I loved the classic burrito making show too - two hands when they lay down each ingredient. It was awesome and I intend to go back again and again. Muy bien echo y sabroso!!!
author: Herlindros H.

description: I eat here probably once a week. The atmosphere may seem simple but if you have ever been to Mexico, you will feel very much at home. As with the decor the food is authentic but most importantly fresh and consistent. That is why I keep coming back!
author: james r.

description:
GREAT FISH TACOS!

I was craving fish tacos and I'm extremely picky about my seafood, but my normal go-to spot was too far so I decided to stop here. I gave it a shot and they did not disappoint!

I ordered a fish ($3.50) and a shrimp ($3.75) taco, which were cooked to perfection. Fish is either cooked very well or terribly, there's nothing in between. The fish here tasted fresh and the seasoning on both tacos was not overwhelming, but just right.

I would definitely come back! 

They also have free chips and salsa!
author: Christal M.

description:
To celebrate National Taco Day (I didn't make that up) last Sunday 10/4, I went to one of my favorite taquerias (I also like Taqueria Cancun). This place is only a couple of years old, it replaced popular Taqueria La Altena.

LOVE the complimentary house made tortilla chips when dining here. Really GOOD chips, much better than what u get at most other places. They have a salsa bar with many choices (fresh chopped salsa, green, red, etc.). But if u place your order to go, they give u "regular" store bought tortilla chips instead.

The menu is VERY extensive - tacos, burritos, quesadillas, tostadas, platos, alambres (skewers), tortas (sandwiches), etc. and they often have specials like nopales (cactus), pozole, etc. hand written on a whiteboard. For dessert sometimes they have a choco flan (2 layers: top half is flan, bottom half is chocolate cake).

There's a large variety of meat choices: carne asada, carnitas, al pastor, chile verde, grilled chicken, stewed chicken, lengua (beef tongue), cabeza (mix of beef head, ears, tongue), sesos (cow brains), buche (pork stomach), etc. Note that they use Mexican crema (a type of rich & sweet heavy cream), instead of the sour cream found at other places.

I like traditional tacos, so I ordered lengua & sesos. I also like their fish ceviche tostada. Delicious!! Plus a cup of cool melon aguas fresca. Cheap, good food, and open late. Highly recommended!
author: Luis C.

description:
Came here on Saturday night around 10pm.  

First, customer service was on point! The workers that we interacted with were friendly which is a big plus in my book! 

I had the pozole rojo which is only available on weekends. It was so good!! 

The fiancé got super nachos with beef tongue (lengua) which was also on point 

The only thing was that the salsa bar was lacking a little bit. But it was 10 at night so that was probably why. Maybe we'll come back for lunch but we Will definitely be back!
author: Jodi P.

description: My family and I just love this place... After living in the excelsior district for 8 years this place was a second home to us but now we have moved to Daly City we still haven't stopped going because I will not try taquerias in DC fyi the owner who owns it is super nice and the younger girls there!! My daughter loves their tacos de lengua my husband the costillitas and me the shrimp cocktail!!! Give it a try you will love it!!!
author: Marale G.

description: Don't fall for the La Taqueria hype. Mexico Tipico has THE BEST burritos i have ever had. (beans, cheese, guacamole, carne asada, rice, cilantro, salsa, onions) folded in a fresh hot tortilla. Super burrito is roughly $8 and its HUGE. Salsa bar is awesome too. Chunky pico with lots of green onion. YUM.
author: Hannah P.

description:
I only recently started liking Mexico Tipico when nearby Taqueria Menudo went downhill.

I've only tried their burritos and nachos but they aim to please! (For the most  part) The pollo guisado is delish! I order it every time. Salsa is good could be spicier but I'm a nut about spice.

My only complaint is the cheese sauce on the nachos. It doesn't taste like real cheese. It reminds me of velveeta cheese or some fake cheese product like that The quality of the nachos would be improved if they used real Mexican cheese. The restaurant IS called Mexico Tipico.
author: Alicia S.

description: So upset I ordered 2 burritos mojados and instead I get regular I requested for my order to be changed and the waiters refused.  Never again and the sad part is I told her in Spanish what I ordered and she begins to argue with me. I don't like to cause a seen so I said fine. My husband went ahead and ate his burrito.  Not to be a snob but poor customer service.
author: Luna S.

description: Solid taqueria.  Great service.  Extensive menu. They will make any item custom to your liking.  Hidden gem.
author: Jesse R.

description:
Rice is cooked and stored in plastic bags.  When asked why they do that in a joking manner, they said there is nothing wrong with that and "El arroz se cocina de esa manera en todas las taquerias."  

Chicken in my mole poblano plate was cold since they brought it out from the refrigerator to heat up in one of their pots.  I started eating and noticed that the breast was hard in the middle.  Well, it was stone cold.  I had one of their workers touch the middle of the chicken breast since they didn't believe me.  The fellow apologized but instead of offering a reheat or something different he turned around. To be clear, I was not rude, didn't raise my voice, and joked with them to bring levity to the situation.  I've eaten here many times before but since the amazing ladies that worked here left a few months ago, their service and cooking has gone down drastically. They lost a customer today, and their crispy chips wont be enough to bring me back.
author: F.D. R.

description:
New hood.  New go-to stop.

The food here was fresh and excellent.  They have a giant wall with pictures on it, and I am set on playing "bingo" and trying every single one of their dishes.

So far I've tried:

Chicken Fajitas
Enchiladas with pork
Fried Camerones (shrimp) Plate
Birria (Goat) Stew

I watched them make all this stuff fresh (except for maybe the stew).  No cheating here, everything was made on-the-spot from raw.  And of the things I've tried, they've all been amazingly delicious.

The ambiance is nothing to write home about unless you like listening to Telemundo at 120 decibels.

The chips are absolutely fantastic, but I ordered to-go once and they gave me bagged chips vs. homemade.  So be aware of that and consider asking for fresh.
author: Rocco B.

description:
This is the best breakfast burrito I've had since moving to SF a few months ago. We will be back to try more of the menu! 

Called for pick-up order and they were friendly on the phone as well as in person. 

Glad to have discovered this little gem in our neck of the woods.
author: Cassie H.

description: I am thoroughly disappointed after coming to this place. After the third time and the third time of them getting my order incorrect I am fed up! The workers there are inattentive and the food is typical. After no remorse for getting my order incorrect the cook then proceeded to put his hand bare in my burrito to pick something out!!!!! I am disgusted they don't even wear gloves. Talk about unsanitary I will never be coming to this place ever again!! The food is average and the customer service is below average.  Save yourself some time and go to La Taqueria or anywhere else but here trust me
author: Nemo F.

description: Great customer service! Great food presentation and taste! I'm a happy customer! I definitely recommend this restaurant to any locals or anyone visiting from out of the area.
author: Joana F.

description:
It's my routine and favorite taqueria place!
I tried tons of taqueria but still there is nowhere like this. Taste good, price is right and the staff is amazing!! From the girls at the register  to the guys at the cook line. If you are a type of person who only eats at fancy places then you are reading a wrong review, go back to your bubble. This place is a neighborhood restaurant and it is amazing. Everything is in the menu is great, burrito, menudo, quesadilla...   
Ay ay ay!
author: Ali C.

description:
I was hesitant to try this place for breakfast. Me and my boo were walking down Mission looking for a breakfast/brunch place. I didn't expect a taqueria would have the traditional American breakfast. Hey, life's full of surprises.

They offer eggs, omelettes, pancakes, toast, sausage, house potatoes...what else could you want?

We enjoyed a filling breakfast for two, drinks included for 18$...now that's a deal! 

Polite service & homey atmosphere. I'll be back to try other items!
author: Nina M.

description: Good taste but really small burritto for the price. Would not go out of my way to eat here.
author: Tina A.

description: Mole Pablano (bone in chicken) $9.75 and Alambres with chicken $9.95 were superb. This place is a must visit. The salsas and chips were on point--thick chips, garlicky salsa verde, and spicy tomato salsa. Pickled vegetables and limes are free. The Mexican beer selection is pretty typical. Outstanding!
author: Daniel E.

description: Really good mexican taqueria food. They have good dinner plates, good burritos, salsa, and agua frescas. Definately a place to come back to when you have the craving.
author: Ronette B.

description:
Basically don't go here if you are white. You'll be waiting 2-3x as long as other customers. Sucks but it's true.

Food is ok. It's close so I do it sometimes. There are 3 other taquerias in the area I would go to first
author: Max R.

description: The best taqueria I've been to in SF so far! My favorite here is the #9 bistek ranchero! It tastes just like homemade! But honestly, everything here is awesome, I've never been disappointed!
author: Daniel M.

description: I had a phenomenal experience, this place is great. Super authentic, my food was made fresh to order. Very reasonably priced and while I was waiting for my meal I got to snack on my own basket of fresh chips, they give with every meal! Plus there is a salsa bar available! So reasonable and so good you can't beat it!!
author: Becca V.

description:
There are Taquerias a'plenty in this very long stretch of Mission Street... Mexico Tipico doesn't stand out from street level, but step indoors and see why it actually is a level well above the rest.

I've come to know and love this Mexican joint after dining here once a week for the last few months. The odd day (4 times to be exact) I decide to switch it up and have my tacos or burritos elsewhere... I can't help but regret not coming here.

Their complimentary chips are supremely fresh, made in-house and the best in the neighborhood when paired with their salsa bar.

They're also a little more eco-friendly than other Taquerias: they have real cutlery and little glass bowls for the salsa, not plastic straight-to-the-already-overstuffed-landfill cutlery & bowls other places offer.

As other reviews have mentioned- the atmosphere is dull, but the quick service & phenomenal food take center stage.

Just ignore the draft of the open door, even on a chilly winter night Mexico Tipico is worth it.
author: Alyssa H.

description:
I absoutly love this place they have the best Civiche! everything is is priced efficenlty and not super expenisve.They are open really late hours. I come here failry often and will contuine to do so. 
My favorite place for a quick bite to eat in SF!
author: Nicole J.

description: This place has the best veggie tacos! I am seriously addicted.  The price is cheap too!
author: Marie B.

description: I love this place!!! This review is long overdue-the food here is delicious and I love the family run style. Takes a little while, but certainly worth The wait!!! All of the ingredients are delicious they make the best beans perfect rice and the meet is incredible. Did I mention the wonderful red sauce on anything?? Huevos rancheros??  The bomb dot com
author: Amy N.

description: This is out go to for Mexican. It's close, delicious and the prices are great even by taquera standards. The people that work there are very friendly as well.
author: Lenny E.

description:
They definitely master the authentic feel - random décor, one Virgin Mary painting, some warning in Spanish (maybe that the place is under 24 hour surveillance?), juicer in the corner, sketchy neighborhood, TV with sports programming, and a framed soccer jersey.  As I was waiting for my order, someone wandered in and asked everyone there for spare change.  Don't come here for ambiance.

The menu includes nachos, tortas, burritos ($4.90 for a regular, your choice of meat), soups (popular with the locals), platillos, enchiladas, beer and Mexican beverages.  They have a salsa bar with three kinds of salsa.  The one that looks like salsa fresca with onions, tomatoes, jalapenos, and cilantro is very spicy, fresh and flavorful.  

I ordered two tacos ($2.35 each) and received a basket of free corn tortilla chips. These were thick, crispy, sweet and fresh.  The tacos (two small corn tortillas) were covered with meat, salsa, onions and finely shredded cilantro.  Simple and fresh, the way I like them.  The tortillas were a little harder and chewier than I'm used to.  I could use more cilantro and onion but maybe they had some at the salsa bar.  The meats are superb and the salsas are excellent.

* Lengua taco: Possibly the most tender lengua chunks I have ever encountered, I was afraid they would fall apart if I poked them too hard with a fork.  Melt in your mouth savory deliciousness.
* Grilled chicken taco: Mmm, loved the tender, highly flavorful chunks of skinless marinated chicken.

The open kitchen makes it easy to see that they make things from scratch.  

$7 credit card minimum
author: Lolia S.

description: I have a feeling Tipico will start showing up on Best of lists.  But if not it's ok, I will still travel out there to get their tasty food.  Finally went for the first time last week and its stars are well deserved.  Asada burrito and ceviche tostada were awesome.  Can't wait to try more.
author: Jason D.

description: Muy bien!!!! Bueno restaurante!!!! Excelente!!!! When I'm here, hot chocolate and a super burrito! Always pleased. People who work here are very nice! This place is the only place where when I get my burrito, and it's fully wrapped!!
author: Samuel B.

description: I'm tired.. This place was SF's last great chance to wow me with mexican food and they failed..  i don't give a crap. This place is far from the five stars these yesmen give this place.  Lousey. Had the Lengua and it is a far cry from anything I'd ever eat twice.
author: Vinny T.

description:
I can not believe I have not written a review!
